In order for something to be either moral or immoral, it must be a choice. Homosexuality, not being a choice, means that it is amoral, it exists outside the scope of morality. You can no more assign a moral value to homosexuality than you can to the color of someone's hair, or how tall they are. 

Many theists will insist that Homosexuality is a choice, and therefore we can assign a moral value to it. However, all of the scientific evidence indicates it is not a choice. This is from the APA [https://www.apa.org/topics/lgbtq/sexual-orientation](https://www.apa.org/topics/lgbtq/sexual-orientation)

The question for theists who say that homosexuality is a choice, how do you square this belief with all of the scientific evidence indicating otherwise, and all of the personal anecdotal evidence from homosexuals explaining it is not a choice. 

Second question for theists, how do you explain the choice of people to be homosexuals, given the horrific social implications that brings with it. Why would anyone choose to be gay in Iran for example, and risk being stoned to death.
